content: this legal case involves a dispute over the coownership of an apartment the court has decided to dissolve the coownership and sell the property through a public auction the proceeds from the sale will be divided equally between the two parties involved one party has been ordered to pay a certain amount to the other party within 15 days the court has considered relevant documents and expert opinions before making this decision the claimants attorney suggests a coownership division while the other partys attorney suggests transferring the entire property to them and paying half of the market value to the claimant the court determines that a physical division is not feasible and a civil division through a public auction is the best solution the court also finds that neither party has a valid reason to terminate the coownership or object to the claimants right to the property the costs of the proceedings will be divided between the parties based on their coownership shares
